abstract: Bryan Caplan, an economist at George Mason University, talks about his new book, “Selfish Reasons to Have More Kids.”
snippet: Bryan Caplan, an economist at George Mason University, talks about his new book, “Selfish Reasons to Have More Kids.”
lead_paragraph: Bryan Caplan, an economist at George Mason, is the author of “Selfish Reasons to Have More Kids,” which will be released this week. Mr. Caplan doesn’t believe everyone should have a lot of children. But he does say many parents and future parents should consider having more children than they are currently planning.

headline.main: The Case for Having More Kids
